Package callOfDuty

Class Base

java.lang.Object
callOfDuty.Base
public class Base extends Object
This contains a 10x10 array of Targets, representing a "base", and some methods to manipulate it. Think of it as the map in this game.
Author:
Yicheng Xia

  • Field Details

    • targets

      private Target[][] targets
      Keeps a reference to the location of every Target in the game. Every location in this array points to a Target, specifically, an instance of a subclass of Target.

    • shotsCount

      private int shotsCount
      The total number of shots fired by the user.

    • destroyedTargetCount

      private int destroyedTargetCount
      The number of targets destroyed.

  • Constructor Details

    • Base

      public Base()
      Creates an 10x10 "empty" Base (and fills the Targets array with Ground objects).

  • Method Details

    • placeAllTargetRandomly

      public void placeAllTargetRandomly()
      Create and place all Targets randomly on the Base (initially filled with Ground).

    • okToPlaceTargetAt

      public boolean okToPlaceTargetAt(Target target, int row, int column, boolean horizontal)
      Based on the given row, column, and orientation, returns true if it is okay to put the Target with its head at this location; false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      target - target to put
      row - row to put target in
      column - column to put target in
      horizontal - horizontal of target
      Returns:
      if it is okay to put the Target

    • isValid

      private boolean isValid(int row, int column)
      Helper method. Returns true if row and column are valid in base, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      row - row to test
      column - column to test
      Returns:
      if row and column are valid in base

    • isInTarget

      private boolean isInTarget(Target target, int i, int j, int row, int column, boolean horizontal)
      Helper method. Returns true if row i and column j are in target, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      target - target to test
      i - row to test
      j - column to test
      row - total row of target
      column - total column of target
      horizontal - horizontal of target
      Returns:
      if row i and column j are in target

    • isBuilding

      private boolean isBuilding(int row, int column)
      Helper method. Returns true if row and column have building in targets, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      row - row to test
      column - column to test
      Returns:
      if row and column have building in targets

    • placeTargetAt

      public void placeTargetAt(Target target, int row, int column, boolean horizontal)
      Sets the value of the "hit" array, "coordinate" array, and "horizontal" boolean value of the target.
      Parameters:
      target - target to put
      row - row to place target at
      column - column to place target at
      horizontal - horizontal of target

    • isOccupied

      public boolean isOccupied(int row, int column)
      Returns true if the given location contains a Target (not a Ground), false if it does not.
      Parameters:
      row - row to test
      column - column to test
      Returns:
      if the given location contains a Target (not a Ground)

    • shootAt

      public void shootAt(int row, int column)
      Attack the position specified by the row and the column.
      Parameters:
      row - row to shoot at
      column - column to shoot at

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver(Weapon weapon1, Weapon weapon2)
      Returns true if run out of ammunition or if all targets have been destroyed. Otherwise return false.
      Parameters:
      weapon1 - first weapon to test
      weapon2 - second weapon to test
      Returns:
      if run out of ammunition or all targets have been destroyed

    • win

      public Boolean win()
      Returns true if all targets have been destroyed.
      Returns:
      if all targets have been destroyed

      public void incrementShotsCount()
